snippet: A government action against TD Bank, brought in connection with a customer’s Ponzi scheme, is noteworthy because it is so rare.
abstract: Floyd Norris applauds government action against TD Bank, noting that it is rare case in which regulators held a bank accountable for a customer Scott Rothstein's Ponzi scheme; contends that it remains unclear whether move, which prompted $52.5 million settlement from bank, represents a new attitude on part of regulators.
lead_paragraph: A government action against TD Bank, brought in connection with a customer’s Ponzi scheme, is noteworthy because it is so rare.

headline.print_headline: After Fraud, Regulators Go After A Bank
headline.main: After Fraud, Regulators Go After a Bank
